metadata.title: CVE-2023-38633 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A directory traversal problem in the URL decoder of librsvg before 2.56.3could be used by local or remote attackers to disclose files (on the localfilesystem outside of the expected area), as demonstrated byhref=".?../../../../../../../../../../etc/passwd" in an xi:include element.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38633` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-rsvg-2.0 - 2.54.5+dfsg-1ubuntu2.1
librsvg2-2 - 2.54.5+dfsg-1ubuntu2.1
librsvg2-bin - 2.54.5+dfsg-1ubuntu2.1
librsvg2-common - 2.54.5+dfsg-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: librsvg package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.54.5+dfsg-1ubuntu2.1').
